clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Prevention of Thromboembolic Disease in Patients With a Lower Limb Trauma, Non Surgical, in Winter Sports Resort
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Prevention of Thromboembolic Disease in Patients With a Lower Limb Trauma, Non Surgical, in Winter Sports Resort.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the impact of thromboembolic diseases and heparin complications in patients with a lower limb trauma supported by physicians of mountain.

detailed_description.textblock:
The "M2M-thrombose" study is a prospective epidemiological multicenter study involving patients with a lower limb trauma in winter sport resorts. The following initial data required are type of immobilization, treatment with LMWH (Low Molecular Weight Heparin), type of injury (serious or not) and the rolling of the step (normal or abnormal) or no weight bearing.
A 3 month follow-up by phone will be realized by the Investigation Clinical Center in Grenoble. Data about risk factors of thromboembolic diseases, anticoagulant therapy, medical history, new event since inclusion (hospitalization, surgery, lower limb trauma or thromboembolic events) will be collected.

primary_outcome.measure: impact of a thromboembolic disease and heparin's complications
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of a thromboembolic disease and heparin's complications in outpatients with a lower limb trauma are supported by physicians in winter sports resort. The patients will be contacted by phone 3 months after trauma to collect these data.

secondary_outcome.measure: compliance with the algorithm for prescribing heparin and consequences on the primary endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint consists to check the impact of thromboembolic disease and adverse effects of anticoagulant therapy at 3 month. We compare the link between these consequences and the compliance with the algorithm about the indication of LMWH therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of thromboembolic diseases and heparin complications in different subgroups
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of subgroups depending on the trauma type, the type of immobilization or not, risk factors of thromboembolic diseases, rolling step and weight bearing.
epidemiological description of included patients (age, sex, travel time...)

secondary_outcome.measure: Epidemiological characteristics of patients with a thromboembolic event or an adverse effect of the treatment

study_pop.textblock: outpatients with a lower limb trauma, in winter sports resorts

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients seen during a consultation with a physician of mountain
- lower limb trauma seen within 48 hours
- patient resident in France
Exclusion Criteria:
- conditions requiring an immediate hospitalization
- prisoners
- pregnant, nursing or parturient woman
- refused participation in follow-up
